metadata.title: CVE-2020-15675 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When processing surfaces, the lifetime may outlive a persistent buffer leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 81.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-15675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
